content.description:
2 Pitches

P1 - 5.9

Climb the friction slab heading mostly directly up.  At last bolt head to the right to the anchors.  Good footwork is your friend.

P2 - 5.9

Head up directly up following the bolts. Climbing to the left of the bolt line is harder than climbing on the right side of the bolt line.

2 raps back to the ground.
content.protection: 12 bolts, 70m and mussy hooks at the anchors.
content.location: 5th route in sequence from Left to Right

content.description:

P1 - 5.7

P2 - 5.9

P3 - 5.8 (dirty)

Rappel down
content.protection: 12 bolts to mussy hooks at each anchor
content.location: Far Right route on this wall

content.description:
70m rope

11 bolts to mussy hooks at the anchor
content.protection: 11 bolts to mussy hooks at the anchor
content.location: On the left side of the large tree.  Very easy to walk right past this route.

climbs.name: Pole Dancer
climbs.fa: Todd Offenbacher, Chris McNamara, Abe Greenspan; 2018

content.description:
P1 - 10b

First pitch trends to the right at the first bolt and then up the slab.

P2 - 5.9

Head directly up the broken rock and onto the black lichen cover slab above.  Anchors are hard to see. They are on the vertical wall up slightly to the right of the last bolt.

P3 - 11c/d

If you are doing the 3rd pitch. It is best to belay from the flat rocks at the base of this pitch.

Startup the broken flakes, cracks to the vertical slab arete feature.  Nice belay ledge to enjoy the view while you being your mate up.

It is possible to reach this pitch by walking directly up to it.  Instead of approaching the base of the routes.  Traverse the hillside at the large boulders heading towards the arete at the edge of the wall.  Bolts are shinny and can be seen once you get closer.

3 raps to the ground.
content.protection: 12 bolts each pitch to mussy hooks at the anchor
content.location: 3rd route in sequence from Left to Right

content.description:
70m rope

10 bolts to mussy hooks at the anchor
content.protection: 10 bolts to mussy hooks at the anchor
content.location: 4th route in sequence from Left to Right

content.description:
Head up the slab into the groove feature trending to the right.

You can also do this route as the first pitch to Pole Dancer.  The anchor are right next to each other.
content.protection: 11 bolts, 70m, and mussy hooks at the anchors.
content.location: 2nd route in sequence from Left to Right
